problem_text: Given a finite p-group G, we define a Φ-extension of G as any finite p-group H containing a normal subgroup N of order p such that H/N ∼= G and N ⩽ Φ(H). Is it true that for every finite p-group G there exists an infinite sequence G = G1, G2, . . . such that Gi+1 is a Φ-extension of Gi for all i = 1, 2, . . .? Ya. G. Berkovich
answer: Yes, it is (S. F. Kamornikov, Izv. Gomel’ Univ., 5 (2008), 200–201 (Russian)).
